title: 'Organic' Rock
description: The ''''Organic' Rock''' minerals are a type of rare scorched and desert biomes. Some have to be mined with the 35px icon.

title: Alliance of Galactic Travellers Banner
description:
Equip this exclusive Personal Flair in support of nomadic and exploratory space travel.

Apply this banner to your profile at an Appearance Modifier.

title: Amino Hub Banner
description:
Equip this exclusive Personal Flair in support of community, adventure and discovery.

Apply this banner to your profile at an Appearance Modifier.

title: Analysis Visor
description:
Specialist Discovery and Survey unit.

Augments standard valuable data when used to study flora, fauna and minerals.

Hold 40px/23px/40px (PS4/PC/Xbox) to operate. Press 40px/25px/40px (PS4/PC/Xbox) to zoom.

title: Appalling Banner
description:
Demonstrate your interest in the macabre and the horrific with this exclusive Personal Flair.

Apply this banner to your profile at an Appearance Modifier.

title: Armoured Suit
description:
{| class="wikitable"
!Image || Cost || Description
|-
|200px || 1000

title: Café 42 Banner
description:
Equip this exclusive Personal Flair in the spirit of friends, fun and good vibes.

Apply this banner to your profile at an Appearance Modifier.

title: CalHub Multi-Tool Catalog
description: The CalHub Multi-Tool Catalog is a collection of images of Multi-tools found within the Galactic Hub Calypso, catalogued by the Galactic Hub Ship Hunters and Galactic Hub Calypso Archivists and other citizens.

title: Carrier AI Fragment
description:
A single splinter of the colossal mainframe at the heart of a Sentinel capital ship. It blinks, its solitary living eye trained upon the one piece of data it retains - the last known location of one of its fleet of Interceptors.

Select the AI Fragment and use Search Archive (E) to translate information about Interceptor's crash site to your starship's navigation systems.

title: Component
description: Components are a type of crafted.

title: Constructed Technology
description: Constructed Technology is a visual index page.

title: Consumable
description: Consumables are single use crafted.

title: Consumable (Atlas)
description: Consumables are single use crafted.

title: Core to Core Jump
description: The Core to Core Jump technique consists in transitioning to the next galaxy via its centre and landing directly in the next galaxy core area. This is achieved by passing through a Black Hole in the core area of the starting galaxy, immediately reaching a Gateway system and then warping to the Galaxy Centre as usual. The spawning point coordinates in the next galaxy will be exactly the same as the black hole exit coordinates.

title: Crafted Products
description: Crafted Products is a visual index page of crafted products.

title: Curiosities
description: Curiousities are a visual index page referenced by Game Content.

title: Curiosity
description:
Curiosities are a type of Points of Interest or required for the completion of certain missions.

Some of them can be crafted or used as ingredients in various blueprints.

title: Deflector Shield (Atlas)
description:
Energy shield that protects spacecraft from laser fire, in-flight projectiles and accidental space debris interaction.
User is advised that Oxide elements are required to recharge device.
Operates automatically once constructed within user's starship inventory.

infobox.desc: Energy shield that protects spacecraft from laser fire, in-flight projectiles and accidental space debris interaction.

title: Detoxified Slime
description:
Gelatinous and slowly pulsing, this puddle of living slime smells sweeter than would be imagined.

Though there is no evidence to suggest it would be unsafe to do so, avoid treading on the slime where possible.

title: Di-hydrogen Jelly
description:
A faintly-glowing jelly. Its gentle light and soft wobble belie the fact that this sticky gel is both highly toxic and highly flammable. Skin contact is to be avoided at all costs.

Synthesised from Di-hydrogen.

title: EisHub Multi-Tool Catalogs
description: EisHub Multi-Tool Catalogs contains an index to albums of Multi-Tools available in the Galactic Hub Eissentam, cataloged by the Galactic Hub Ship Hunters (GHSH).

title: Erverdiso XVII - Multi-tool Catalog
description:
This page contains a list of Multi-tools available in the Erverdiso XVII Star system, cataloged by the Galactic Hub Ship Hunters (GHSH).

The system can be reached using the glyph string

title: Exosuit
description: The Exosuit is the outfit that a player's avatar wears in No Man’s Sky. It provides storage for items that an avatar carries; offers protection from planetary hazards, hazardous sentinels; and comes equipped with a jetpack. It has expandable Appearance Modifiers on Space Stations.

title: Exosuit Research Terminal
description:
Exosuit Research Terminal is a terminal used to unlock exosuit upgrade blueprints in exchange for Salvaged Data. It is located aboard the Space Anomaly, alongside the other research terminals such as the Starship Research Terminal and Multi-Tool Research Terminal.

Players interact with the Exosuit Research Terminal to purchase various personal technology upgrades that enhance their Exosuit capabilities, such as movement, storage, and survival modules. These upgrades are essential for improving survivability and mobility across hazardous environments.

Available technology categories include:
* Life Support Modules
* Movement Modules
* Hazard Protection Modules
* Shield Modules

Note: This terminal is not the same as the Exosuit Upgrade Station, which is used to unlock inventory slots using Units rather than blueprints. Both are located aboard the Space Anomaly but serve different purposes.

title: Experiment
description: One of the more common multi-tool name prefixes is the word Experiment.

title: Frameshift Catapult
description:
This experimental drive augments conventional hyperdrive technology by distorting local geometry at the point of warp initialisation, boosting range and efficiency far beyond standard drives.

User is advised to access Hyperdrive systems through the Galactic Map.

infobox.desc: FTL propulsion drive for warp speed

title: Fuel elements
description:
Fuel elements are mainly used as an ingredient for crafting or refining into various products.

Also glyph 1 / 16, glyph 4 / 16, glyph 7 / 16, glyph 10 / 16 and glyph 13 / 16 are need to be charged with these type of elements, before a portal could be activated.

title: Galactic Hub Multi-tool Catalog
description: This page contains an index to albums of Multi-tools available in the Galactic Hub, cataloged by the Galactic Hub Ship Hunters (GHSH).

title: Grafted Eyes
description: A complex array of membranes and lens, fused atop a high-energy laser array. Incineration awaits those that meet their stare.

title: Grenade technology
description: Grenade technology is technology that upgrades a player's Plasma Launcher.

title: HUB4-73 New Beginnings - Multi-tool Catalog
description:
This page contains a visual overview of Multi-tools available in the HUB4-73 New Beginnings Star system in the Calypso galaxy, cataloged by the Galactic Hub Ship Hunters (GHSH).

The system can be reached using the glyph string

title: Handheld Laser
description:
The Handheld Laser, which is a part of the Illicles. Since then, it has been widely speculated to be the primary weapon of No Man's Sky, though the developers have been relatively tight-lipped concerning the weapon. It has also been suggested as a mining tool, though there is little evidence to back up this claim.

The laser option of the multi-tool is known as LAZEUS.

Category:Multi-Tool

title: Hazard Protection Unit
description: Hazard Protection Units are extensions for the players' Oxide or with Shielding Products such as Shielding Shard, Shielding Sheet and Shielding Plate.

title: Horrific Flesh-Helmet
description:
Naturally transform your appearance via the application of a flesh-hungry parasite. This living being partially fuses with the brainstem of its host, sealing their symbiosis.

Cautiously transform the appearance of your Exosuit at an Appearance Modifier.

title: Hyaline Brain
description:
The central processing unit of a Sentinel interceptor ship. The circuitry writhes microscopically, constantly rearranging itself as it scans for anomalies.

A vital component for any entity wishing to construct their own Pilot Interface for a Sentinel Interceptor.

Status: VOLATILE

title: Incinerator
description:
Specialist high temperature weapon attachment for the Multi-Tool. Access fire mode by pressing CYCLEWEAPON and fire weapon with ATTACK.

The Incinerator focuses internal lasers onto the naturally-occuring exhaust gases generated by the Multi-Tool. Ignition results in a highly destructive, if short range, inferno.

title: Inverted Mirror
description:
A pane of watchful g l a s s, retrieved from the smoking remains of the corrupted swarm's Dissonance Resonators. It emits more light than it reflects, casting a faint purple hue on its surroundings.

Highly sought after for salvage operations, as it can be used to bypass the security systems of key Sentinel ship technologies.

title: Launch Thruster
description:
Vital launch and landing gear system.

User is advised that specialised, Deuterium-derived fuel is required to recharge thruster. Launch procedures require sufficient fuel levels before activation.

Hold [W] to take off from planet.

Hold [Circle/Shift/B] to initiate in-flight speed boost.

infobox.desc: Used during initial takeoff and landings

title: Multi-Tool Catalogue
description: Every multi-tool has a different specialisation type - select a link for a catalogue of that specific specialization.

title: Multi-tool Catalogue (Atlas)
description:
The following provides an index of various multi-tools discovered by different players.

They are separated by specialisation, and then by general class in alphabetical order on the sub-index pages.

Remember that each multi-tool is available in all class grades, so it is important to know which design is best suited to you when looking for a new multi-tool.

title: Multi-tools - Other (Pathfinder)
description: The multi-tools listed below either have no picture or additional information to enable categorization.

title: Neural Assembly
description: An array of distributed neurons, fused to a board of metallic strands. Complex patterns of electrical impulses weave their way across the surface, knotting each ship system together.

infobox.desc: Used during initial takeoff and landings

title: Phase Beam (Atlas)
description:
Spacefaring beam weapon and asteroid mining tool.

User is advised that Isotope elements are required to recharge device.

Press ... to activate.

infobox.desc: One of the two primary ship weapons

title: Pirate Transponder
description:
A unique ID transponder, ripped from the internal signal array of an outlaw starship.

Possesion

title: Price Catalogue - Multi-Tools
description:
Price Catalogue - Multi-Tools consist of several tables that indicate the price of Multi-tools according to archetype and slots count. 

Be aware that all possibilities do not happen in every system.

The prices are in thousands of units.

title: Quad Servo
description: A highly sprung motor arm salvaged from inside of a Sentinel patrol unit. It occasionally twitches, as if experiencing the echo of combat.

title: Recovered Item (COG)
description:
A damaged technology component, ejected from its machine and discarded by its owner.

Worthless, except as scrap. Select in the Inventory (

title: Recovered Item (DATA)
description: Recovered Item (DATA) is a procedural item, specifically a Recovered Item.

title: Recovered Item (LUMP)
description:
A scrap of organic matter. It is not clear if this is a lifeform in its own right, or some ejected/severed part of a larger being.

Unlikely to be desirable at a galactic exchange. Select in the Inventory (

title: Refining Multiplication of Resources
description:
This guide will provide instructions and steps for maximum production of resources without having to collect or farm them (where possible).

The objective is to obtain the maximum types and amounts of resources using only a Portable Refiner, Medium Refiner, Large Refiner.

Some of these recipes use two or three ingredients, so a large refiner is required in most cases, but having another one- and two-input refiner nearby will help speed up some of the simpler processes. The more refiners that are available, the better, as that allows for multiple processes to be run in parallell.

title: Resource
description:
Resources in No Man's Sky are organised as Raw Materials in the in-game Guide based on type. When resources are mined, they are broken down into their chemical elements, and these can be combined into new products to be sold on the galactic market.

Technology is dependent on certain elements, so collecting element resources and alloys can unlock new multi-tools, starships, etc.

Resources can be obtained in a wide variety of ways. They can be purchased, mined from raw elements on the ground of planets (either by hand or with an Autonomous Mining Unit), mined from asteroids in space, harvested from plants, collected from the air (with an Atmosphere Harvester or Oxygen Harvester), given to you as gifts from animals you befriend, found in crates and containers on planet surfaces, and harvested by killing plants, animals and even sentinels. The abundance of elements varies significantly from one planet to another, and may be totally absent on a particular planet. As a result, some resources are easiest to obtain in ways other than mining.

Resources may also be converted into other resources with the use of the three different sized refiners.

title: Resource (Atlas)
description: Resources in AMU), mined from asteroids in space, harvested from plants, given to you as gifts from animals you befriend, found in crates and containers on planet surfaces, and harvested by killing plants or animals or mining mineral formations. The abundance of elements varies significantly from one planet to another, and some resources are easiest to obtain in specific ways.

title: Singularity Cortex
description:
A complex bio-metallic stem plugged directly into an antimatter heart. Registers high activity during interstellar jumps. It appears to delight in the complex calculations required for FTL travel.

Access long-distance navigation systems through Galactic Map. Keep the ship happy by regularly jumping between systems.

infobox.desc: FTL propulsion drive for warp speed

title: Technology (Atlas)
description:
thumb|Inventory page for a ship
There are four basic upgrade levels, labeled by Greek letters. In order of improvement they are:
* SIGMA
* TAU
* THETA
* OMEGA

Note that very few of the technologies have an OMEGA version of improvement.

When upgrading technology, there are twelve specific areas that can be upgraded. These are shown on the right hand side of three separate upgrade panels (exosuit, multi-tool, and starship).

Each icon has a number of rings surrounding it. As upgrades to that particular area of technology are made, the rings are filled in to indicate the current status level. Note that in the graphic, the Weapons icon has two circles partially filled in, corresponding to the Phase Beam and Photon Cannon. On the other hand, the Hyperdrive icon has one circle, representing a completed Hyperdrive.

title: Tentacled Banner
description:
Express your curiosity about abyssal alien lifeforms with this exclusive Personal Flair.

Apply this banner to your profile at an Appearance Modifier.

title: Toxin Suppressor (NEXT)
description:
'Toxin Suppressor protection is a series of Exosuit upgrades that protects the user from from toxic liquids on a planet's surface.

Reactive compounds within the Suppressor unit remove toxic liquids that fall on the user, thereby reducing peril and choking hazards. Each upgrade increases the effectiveness of the protection.

infobox.desc: User is guarded from toxic liquids

title: Wriggling Companion
description:
The captured essence of an abyssal horror, contained for scientific and decorative use.

The bounding forcefield is of the very highest quality. The companion cannot escape. The companion will not escape. Escape.
